extendedIngredients.name: green bell pepper
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 medium green bell pepper finely chopped

title: Instant Pot Chicken Taco Soup

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Noir, Riesling, and Sparkling rosÃ© are great choices for Mexican. Acidic white wines like riesling or low-tannin reds like pinot noir can work well with Mexican dishes. Sparkling rosÃ© is a safe pairing too. You could try The Donum Estate Russian River Valley Pinot Noir. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.9 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 67 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: The Donum Estate Russian River Valley Pinot Noir
productMatches.description: This Pinot Noir displays abundant and intense aromas of ripe black fruits, including cherry, plum and raspberry, in a complex and concentrated nose. Smooth and richly textured, the wine offers great depth of black cherry, berry and cola flavors with notes of mineral and spice on a bright and long-lasting finish.

instructions:
Instructions:
Press the Saute button on the Instant Pot and heat oil. Add onion and bell pepper and saute until translucent. Add tomatoes including juice and add water. Make sure to scrape all of the bits from the sides and bottom of the Instant Pot as you are stirring.
Add chicken, chili powder, corn, black beans, green onions, green chilis, and  cup of cilantro. Lock lid. Press the manual or pressure cook button and set time for 15 minutes. When time is up, do a quick release until the valve drops and then unlock the lid. Shred the chicken using two forks and then let the soup simmer for 5 minutes.
Serve the soup into bowls and then top with your favorite toppings such as sour cream, cheese, avocado, etc.

steps.step: Saute button on the Instant Pot and heat oil.
Add onion and bell pepper and saute until translucent.
Add tomatoes including juice and add water. Make sure to scrape all of the bits from the sides and bottom of the Instant Pot as you are stirring.

Add chicken, chili powder, corn, black beans, green onions, green chilis, and  cup of cilantro. Lock lid. Press the manual or pressure cook button and set time for 15 minutes. When time is up, do a quick release until the valve drops and then unlock the lid. Shred the chicken using two forks and then let the soup simmer for 5 minutes.
Serve the soup into bowls and then top with your favorite toppings such as sour cream, cheese, avocado, etc.
